original: Pure.CSS is a Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) framework developed by Yahoo. It is used to make website faster, beautiful and responsive.
result: Pure.CSS is a CSS framework created by Yahoo that enables users to enhance the beauty, responsiveness, and speed of their website.

original: It has in-built responsive designing.
result: The software possesses a responsive design that is already integrated.

original: It uses satandard CSS with minimal footprint.
result: The tool employs a lightweight and standard CSS, ensuring that it has minimal file size and can be easily integrated into different projects.

original: It is a collection of small, responsive CSS modules.
result: The set of CSS modul es called "Milligram" is a group of small, adaptable modules designed to quickly and easily create responsive layouts.

original: It supports shadow and bold colors.
result: This feature allows for the usage of both shadow and bold colors.

original: The colors and shades remain uniform across various platforms and devices.
result: Consistency in color and tone is maintained consistently across multiple platforms and devices.

original: Standard CSS is very easy to lean and there is no dependency on any external JavaScript library such as jQuery. Standard CSS is used by Pure.CSS.
result: You can easily learn standard CSS without relying on any external libraries such as jQuery. It's a simple and straightforward language used by Pure.CSS.

original: PURE.CSS provides several special classes to create a responsive design:
result: Several special classes are available in PURE.CSS to assist in creating a responsive design.

original: PURE.CSS provides concept of Pure Grid with two types of classes:
result: Pure.css framework facilitates the implementation of a Pure Grid system that has two distinct categories of classes.

original: Following are the rules to use Pure.CSS Grids:
result: Here are the guidelines that need to be adhered to when working with Pure.CSS Grids:

original: Widths of Units are in fractions. For example, pure-u-1-2 represents 1/2 or 50% width, pure-u-2-5 represents 2/5 or 40% width and so on.
result: The measurements of the units are expressed in fractions. These fractions indicate the percentage of width allocated to a particular unit. For instance, a unit labeled as pure-u-1-2 signifies that it occupies a width that is 50% of the total width, while a unit marked as pure-u-2-5 takes up 40% or 2/5 of the available width.

original: Children of Pure Grid (element with pure-g class) must be using pure-u or pure-u-* classnames.
result: Please ensure that any children of the Pure Grid element, which uses the 'pure-g' class, are using classnames that begin with 'pure-u' or 'pure-u-*'.

original: All content should be a part of a grid unit to be rendered properly.
result: To display content accurately, it must be aligned with grid units.

original: Pure is elegant, simple, and lightweight. It is very easy to work with. The biggest advantage of using Pure CSS is it is built to be extensible. You can simply add a few styles in your own CSS and change the look to your website.
result: Pure CSS is a popular choice for web designers as it provides an elegant, simple and lightweight solution for styling web pages. Its user-friendly design and extensibility make it easy to work with, and the advantage of using it is that you can easily add your own styles to create a unique look for your website.

original: Local installation is a process of downloading pure-min.css file in a directory of your website, e.g. /css and then use the CSS file in your HTML page.
result: To perform a local installation, you must first obtain the pure-min.css file and save it in a designated directory on your website, such as /css. Once the file has been saved, you can reference it in your HTML code to apply the formatting and styles to your page.

original: You can include the Pure.CSS file into your HTML code directly from the Content Delivery Network (CDN). yui.yahooapis.com provides content for the latest version.
result: One option to add the Pure.CSS file to your HTML code is by linking it directly from the Content Delivery Network (CDN). The latest version of Pure.CSS can be obtained from yui.yahooapis.com.

original: There are two types of menus in Pure.CSS:
result: Pure.CSS offers users two distinct types of menus.

original: Pure.CSS provides vertical menus by default. You can change the vertical menu to horizontal menu by adding the class name "pure-menu-horizontal".
result: Pure.CSS comes with vertical menus as the default menu layout. However, if you want a horizontal menu instead, you can simply add the class name "pure-menu-horizontal".

original: C Programming Interview Questions
result: Below are some sample interview questions for C programming that can help you prepare for your upcoming job interview.

original: Data Structure Interview Questions
result:
Sure, here is the rephrased version of the original content:

Interviews for data structure positions can be challenging, so it's best to prepare well in advance. Here are some common questions that interviewers may ask:

1. Can you explain what a data structure is and give some examples?
2. What is the difference between an array and a linked list?
3. How would you implement a stack using an array?
4. What is a binary search tree, and how does it work?
5. Can you explain the concept of hashing and give an example of its use?
6. How do you sort an array, and what are some common sorting algorithms?

Be sure to review these topics and practice coding solutions to related problems. Good luck with your interview!
